com.uwsoft.editor.renderer

Class SceneLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uwsoft.editor.renderer.SceneLoader

  • public class SceneLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    SceneLoader is importatn part of runtime that utilizes provided IResourceRetriever (or creates default one shipped with runtime) in order to load entire scene data into viewable actors provides the functionality to get root actor of scene and load scenes. Created by azakhary on 9/9/2014.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Essentials essentials 
      CompositeItem sceneActor 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SceneLoader()
      Empty constructor is intended for easy use, it will create default ResourceManager, and load all possible resources into memory that have been exported with editor
      SceneLoader(Essentials e)
      Sets essentials container with or without content for later use This the most dummy contructor
      SceneLoader(IResourceRetriever rm)
      Sets your implementation of IResourceRetriever, and does not load anything
      SceneLoader(java.lang.String resolution)
      intended for easy use, it will create default ResourceManager, and load all possible resources into memory that have been exported with editor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addScriptTo(java.lang.String name, java.util.ArrayList<IScript> iScripts) 
      void addScriptTo(java.lang.String name, IScript iScript) 
      CompositeItem getCompositeElement(CompositeItemVO vo)
      Creates CompositeItem by provided CompositeItemVO data class
      CompositeItem getCompositeElementById(java.lang.String id)
      Returns CompositeItem that is inside rootScene identified by unique id set in Editor does not perform deep search inside other composites
      CompositeItem getLibraryAsActor(java.lang.String name)
      Loads CompositeItem from Library by using it's library name So you can get item that is not on the scene, but is stored in library for later use Works great for dialogs and thigns like that TODO: this should be also renamed as name is confusing
      IResourceRetriever getRm() 
      CompositeItem getRoot() 
      CompositeItem getSceneAsActor()
      Creates CompositeItem from sceneVo *
      SceneVO getSceneVO() 
      void invalidateSceneVO(SceneVO vo)
      Checks scene for continuity errors
      SceneVO loadScene(java.lang.String sceneName)
      Asks IResourceRetriever for sceneVO data, checks scene for errors and Recreates a big Actor tree that you can later add to your stage for rendering Applies resolution set previously with setResolution method or uses "orig" default resolution Sets default ambient light using scene data
      SceneVO loadScene(java.lang.String sceneName, boolean createActors)
      Asks IResourceRetriever for sceneVO data, checks scene for errors Applies resolution set previously with setResolution method or uses "orig" default resolution Sets default ambient light using scene data
      void removeMissingImages(CompositeVO vo)
      Checks if composite data contains any scene items with images not provided by resource retriever, and removes them from composite to at least show what is not missing
      void setAmbienceInfo(SceneVO vo)
      Sets ambient light to the one specified in scene from editor
      void setResolution(java.lang.String resolutionName)
      Sets resolution of the screen, and applies it to existing actors if already loaded

    • Method Detail

      • setResolution

        public void setResolution(java.lang.String resolutionName)
        Sets resolution of the screen, and applies it to existing actors if already loaded
        Parameters:
        resolutionName - - String resolution name to load everything for 9default is "orig"

      • getSceneVO

        public SceneVO getSceneVO()
        Returns:
        SceneVO data if scene is already loaded with loadScene

      • loadScene

        public SceneVO loadScene(java.lang.String sceneName,
                boolean createActors)
        Asks IResourceRetriever for sceneVO data, checks scene for errors Applies resolution set previously with setResolution method or uses "orig" default resolution Sets default ambient light using scene data
        Parameters:
        sceneName - - String scene name without ".dt" extension
        createActors - - if true the root composite with entire actor list will be created
        Returns:
        SceneVO data file of loaded scene (you don't really need it at this point though...)

      • loadScene

        public SceneVO loadScene(java.lang.String sceneName)
        Asks IResourceRetriever for sceneVO data, checks scene for errors and Recreates a big Actor tree that you can later add to your stage for rendering Applies resolution set previously with setResolution method or uses "orig" default resolution Sets default ambient light using scene data
        Parameters:
        sceneName - - String scene name without ".dt" extension
        Returns:
        SceneVO data file of loaded scene (you don't really need it at this point though...)

      • invalidateSceneVO

        public void invalidateSceneVO(SceneVO vo)
        Checks scene for continuity errors
        Parameters:
        vo - - Scene data file to invalidate

      • removeMissingImages

        public void removeMissingImages(CompositeVO vo)
        Checks if composite data contains any scene items with images not provided by resource retriever, and removes them from composite to at least show what is not missing
        Parameters:
        vo - - Scene data file to invalidate

      • setAmbienceInfo

        public void setAmbienceInfo(SceneVO vo)
        Sets ambient light to the one specified in scene from editor
        Parameters:
        vo - - Scene data file to invalidate

      • getSceneAsActor

        public CompositeItem getSceneAsActor()
        Creates CompositeItem from sceneVo *
        Returns:
        CompositeItem

      • getLibraryAsActor

        public CompositeItem getLibraryAsActor(java.lang.String name)
        Loads CompositeItem from Library by using it's library name So you can get item that is not on the scene, but is stored in library for later use Works great for dialogs and thigns like that TODO: this should be also renamed as name is confusing
        Parameters:
        name - String - library item name
        Returns:
        CompositeItem Actor

      • getCompositeElementById

        public CompositeItem getCompositeElementById(java.lang.String id)
        Returns CompositeItem that is inside rootScene identified by unique id set in Editor does not perform deep search inside other composites
        Parameters:
        id - - String uniqe identifier
        Returns:
        - CompositeItem
